intro: Brachycorythis gerrardii, commonly known as the serrated leaf rockrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are characterized by their serrated edges. It is part of the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
